newsitem.title: USA: Grupo Elektra increases stake in Hecali.
newsitem.headline: Grupo Elektra increases stake in Hecali.

text.p: Grupo Elektra SA said Friday it has increased its stake in the Hecali basic family clothing retail chain to 88.2 percent from 68.7 percent, acquiring all remaining shares from the founding Saba family.

The company said it purchased its original 66 percent stake in Hecali in October, 1996, for 40.8 million pesos. Elektra has since purchased the Saba family's remaining 19.5 percent interest. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed. The
remaining shares are allotted to mangement and employees of Hecali.

Hecali had 30 stores when Elektra assumed control. Elektra said today the store count will reach 75 within a few days, increasing the size of the chain one and a half times since acquisition. Elektra plans to expand the store network to 300 over the next several years.
